content:
Racita stood by Jacob's side, her soft, warm light encasing him like a protective shield. He struggled against Lorelei's hold, trying to break free and speak to Racita, but all that came out was twisted praise for the evil spirit.

"Hold on, Jacob," Racita whispered soothingly, laying a gentle hand on his shoulder. "We're going to get you out of here."

The void shook as Eri and Lorelei clashed, their energies colliding in a shower of sparks and light. Despite the chaos around him, Jacob felt safe and protected with Racita by his side.

"Don't listen to her," Racita continued, her voice firm and unyielding. "She's trying to twist your mind and control you. You're stronger than she thinks."

As the battle raged on, Jacob's sobs slowly turned to sniffles and his distorted praise slowly faded away. He closed his eyes, drawing comfort from Racita's presence and the knowledge that he was no longer alone.

"We're going to get you home," Racita promised, as the void shook once more and the battle reached its climax.
